data.message:
The only thing Brazilian Jovane Guissone has to do during the Games is defend his gold medal in wheelchair fencing on home soil. 

No pressure.

In the Paralympic Games, swimming includes events for athletes with physical, visual and intellectual impairments. Unlike athletics, no prosthetics are allowed. Swimmers use four strokes and in Rio there are 151 medal events for men, women and mixed relay teams.
Hal from Colorado came to Rio to see the Olympic and Paralympic Games for his ELEVENTH time. He came to the top of Corcovado to say how special the Paralympics will be.
They have arrived! Some of the Paralympic delegations started moving into the Paralympic village today!

The Games are coming! Delegations are arriving at the Paralympic Village just a week ahead of the Games. 

Photos: Alexandre Vidal / Rio2016
data.story: Rio 2016 added 51 new photos to the album: Paralympians arrive at the Paralympic Village.

data.message:
Have you met Rio 2016's Paralympic mascot Tom? 

He's a magical creature - a fusion of all the plants in the Brazilian forests - named after Tom Jobim, composer of "The Girl from Ipanema".
Check out the pictograms for the Rio 2016 Paralympic Games! ðŸŽ‰
One week until the Paralympics and the athletes are already arriving in Rio! #Rio2016

Wheelchair fencing made its debut at the Paralympic Games in 1960.  Like able-bodied fencing, three types of weapons are used--foil, epee and sabre. Fencers may not rise from the seated position during the bout.
Judoka LÃºcia Teixeira, who won silver in London and starred in the award-winning Rio 2016 'Mindchanger Workout' film, will compete for Brazil in Paralympic Games!
No Paralympian has ever crossed the 300kg weightlifting line. With a personal record of 296kg this year, Siamand Rahman is going for it in Rio.
The Rio 2016 organising committee has partnered with the Rio de Janeiro state government to provide 33,000 tickets for local teenagers to experience the Paralympic Games.

Powerlifting is the ultimate test of upper body strength. Athletes who compete in the sport have lower-limb physical impairments or short stature and often lift three times their body weight in a bench press.
It's on! 1 million tickets sold for the Paralympic Games. Don't miss out.
Here's a sneak peek of the Tokyo 2020 Olympic and Paralympic venues. See you there in four years?
Just 8 days until the Games begin! #ParalympicGames
Para-canoe will make its debut at the 2016 Paralympic Games! Competition at the Summer Paralympic Games will consist of sprint races over a 200m straight line course.
Rio 2016 Paralympic Games - 7 to 18 September

Are you ready for the Rio 2016 Opening Ceremony? 

We're going to start the Paralympic Games with a party ðŸŽ‰

Only 9 Days to go until the Paralympic Games! 

Words can't explain. You have to be there.

â€œDonâ€™t ever pity me for the way I was born." - Shanntol Ince

Proud to be different. Proud to represent Trinidad and Tobago around the world. Next stop Rio 2016.
Check out the biggest names competing in wheelchair tennis at the Paralympic Games.
Paralympic athlete Amy Purdy will dance on running prosthetics for the Opening Ceremony of the Paralympic Games. This will be an amazing moment! Don't miss it!
Boccia: In the Paralympics, the sport is played by wheelchair athletes who propel blue or red balls as close as possible to the white ball - the "jack."
Ahmed Kelly was born without limbs in Iraq and now the swimmer is gearing up to represent Australia at the Paralympic Games.
